threat_title: CLI Command Injection via Unvalidated Inputs
justification: High damage potential from arbitrary code execution, moderate reproducibility via user input, moderate exploitability requiring user interaction, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to input validation oversight.
recommendations: Implement strict input validation and sanitization for CLI parameters; Use least-privilege execution for build processes; Enable logging and monitoring for suspicious CLI activity

justification: High damage potential from executing malicious build scripts, moderate reproducibility via social engineering, moderate exploitability requiring user trust, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to spoofing detection challenges.
recommendations: Implement certificate pinning for CLI frontend authenticity; Use multi-factor authentication for build initiation; Enforce strict script signing and verification policies

justification: Medium damage from information disclosure, high reproducibility via network interception, moderate exploitability for passive eavesdropping, system-wide impact, and medium discoverability due to common network monitoring tools.
recommendations: Implement TLS encryption for all data in transit; Use secure protocols with perfect forward secrecy; Regularly audit network traffic for sensitive data

threat_title: Elevation of Privilege via Package Manager Vulnerabilities
justification: High damage from privilege escalation, moderate reproducibility via package manager exploits, moderate exploitability requiring system access, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to complex attack vectors.
recommendations: Regularly update and patch package manager integrations; Implement role-based access controls for package management; Enable runtime privilege separation for dependency resolution

threat_title: Denial of Service via Resource Exhaustion
justification: High damage from system unavailability, high reproducibility via resource exhaustion attacks, moderate exploitability requiring system access, system-wide impact, and medium discoverability due to resource monitoring tools.
recommendations: Implement resource quotas and rate limiting; Monitor system metrics for abnormal usage patterns; Design for graceful degradation under load
